availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Nichols (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Son of Nancy Nichols. Married to Nancy "Nannie" E. Woodruff Nichols. Father of J. W. Nichols. Attended school in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Caldwell County in 1860. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 282A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 347B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 79.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 478A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Caldwell County, KY, June 1863, p. 31 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "John R. Nichols (1837-1871)," Memorial #89887066, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89887066 (accessed April 12, 2021).
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administrators Bonds, 1830-1869, p. 414.
